page.title: 08Allotment Gardens
page.content: In our area are two patches of allotments, A is in{Herringston Rd.} and B is in{Alington Ave.}Altogether there are about eight acres of allotments. In area A there are approximately forty plots and in B there are seventy to eighty. The rent for each plot is Â£4.50 per year. People say that they have allotments for the following reasons:- Some live in flats with no gardens. Some just enjoy the hobby of gardening and some grow vegetables to eat. Most people with allotments live close by, and work in them regularly. The things most often grown are potatoes, broad beans and runner beans. If the new by-pass takes the Southern Route, some of the allotments will be lost, but there will be some new ones created in small pockets of left over land.
